page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content: Newport on Tay is a fairly small town in the parish of Forgan situated on the south bank of the Tay in North East Fife. It consists of two small villages; Wormit and Newport. Both gradually joined into each other. Wormit was established when the Tay Rail Bridge opened and Newport was originally a ferry-port. The railway station is now closed but people generally use the road bridge anyway. Most people in Newport work in Dundee, using here as a dormitory town. The poulation has changed rapidly over the years from around 1000 in the 1830's to nearly 4000 in the parish at the last census in 1981. The area surrounding Newport on Tay is mainly gentle hills and fertile farmland with lots of trees spotted all over the place.
